verses.esv: 15 See to it that no one fails to obtain the grace of God; that no “root of bitterness” springs up and causes trouble, and by it many become defiled;
verses.kjv: 15 Looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you, and thereby many be defiled;
verses.niv: 15 See to it that no one misses the grace of God and that no bitter root grows up to cause trouble and defile many.

verses.esv: 31 Let all bitterness and wrath and anger and clamor and slander be put away from you, along with all malice.
verses.kjv: 31 Let all bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamour, and evil speaking, be put away from you, with all malice:
verses.niv: 31 Get rid of all bitterness, rage and anger, brawling and slander, along with every form of malice.

verses.esv: 23 For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of iniquity.”
verses.kjv: 23 For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and in the bond of iniquity.
verses.niv: 23 For I see that you are full of bitterness and captive to sin."

verses.esv: 31 Let all bitterness and wrath and anger and clamor and slander be put away from you, along with all malice. 32 Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.
verses.kjv: 31 Let all bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamour, and evil speaking, be put away from you, with all malice: 32 And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ’s sake hath forgiven you.
verses.niv: 31 Get rid of all bitterness, rage and anger, brawling and slander, along with every form of malice. 32 Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.

verses.esv: 26 Be angry and do not sin; do not let the sun go down on your anger,
verses.kjv: 26 Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your wrath:
verses.niv: 26 "In your anger do not sin": Do not let the sun go down while you are still angry,

verses.esv: 14     “Their mouth is full of curses and bitterness.”
verses.kjv: 14 Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness:
verses.niv: 14 "Their mouths are full of cursing and bitterness."

verses.esv: 14 Strive for peace with everyone, and for the holiness without which no one will see the Lord. 15 See to it that no one fails to obtain the grace of God; that no “root of bitterness” springs up and causes trouble, and by it many become defiled;
verses.kjv: 14 Follow peace with all men, and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord: 15 Looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you, and thereby many be defiled;
verses.niv: 14 Make every effort to live in peace with all men and to be holy; without holiness no one will see the Lord. 15 See to it that no one misses the grace of God and that no bitter root grows up to cause trouble and defile many.

verses.esv:
10:1   “I loathe my life;
  I will give free utterance to my complaint;
    I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.kjv: 1 My soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.niv: 1 "I loathe my very life; therefore I will give free rein to my complaint and speak out in the bitterness of my soul.

verses.esv:
10   The heart knows its own bitterness,
    and no stranger shares its joy.
verses.kjv: 10 The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.
verses.niv: 10 Each heart knows its own bitterness, and no one else can share its joy.

verses.esv: 14 For if you forgive others their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you, 15 but if you do not forgive others their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
verses.kjv: 14 For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you: 15 But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
verses.niv: 14 For if you forgive men when they sin against you, your heavenly Father will also forgive you. 15 But if you do not forgive men their sins, your Father will not forgive your sins.

verses.esv:
25   A foolish son is a grief to his father
    and bitterness to her who bore him.
verses.kjv: 25 A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him.
verses.niv: 25 A foolish son brings grief to his father and bitterness to the one who bore him.

verses.esv:
11   “Therefore I will not restrain my mouth;
    I will speak in the anguish of my spirit;
    I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.kjv: 11 Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.niv: 11 "Therefore I will not keep silent; I will speak out in the anguish of my spirit, I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

verses.esv:
25   Another dies in bitterness of soul,
    never having tasted of prosperity.
verses.kjv: 25 And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.
verses.niv: 25 Another man dies in bitterness of soul, never having enjoyed anything good.

verses.esv:
12   Hatred stirs up strife,
    but love covers all offenses.
verses.kjv: 12 Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.
verses.niv: 12 Hatred stirs up dissension, but love covers over all wrongs.

verses.esv: 25 And whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone, so that your Father also who is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.”
verses.kjv: 25 And when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.
verses.niv: 25 And when you stand praying, if you hold anything against anyone, forgive him, so that your Father in heaven may forgive you your sins."

verses.esv: 8 But now you must put them all away: anger, wrath, malice, slander, and obscene talk from your mouth.
verses.kjv: 8 But now ye also put off all these; anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.
verses.niv: 8 But now you must rid yourselves of all such things as these: anger, rage, malice, slander, and filthy language from your lips.

verses.esv: 14 The Spirit lifted me up and took me away, and I went in bitterness in the heat of my spirit, the hand of the LORD being strong upon me.
verses.kjv: 14 So the spirit lifted me up, and took me away, and I went in bitterness, in the heat of my spirit; but the hand of the LORD was strong upon me.
verses.niv: 14 The Spirit then lifted me up and took me away, and I went in bitterness and in the anger of my spirit, with the strong hand of the LORD upon me.

verses.esv: 13 bearing with one another and, if one has a complaint against another, forgiving each other; as the Lord has forgiven you, so you also must forgive.
verses.kjv: 13 Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so also do ye.
verses.niv: 13 Bear with each other and forgive whatever grievances you may have against one another. Forgive as the Lord forgave you.

verses.esv:
17   Behold, it was for my welfare
    that I had great bitterness;
  but in love you have delivered my life
    from the pit of destruction,
  for you have cast all my sins
    behind your back.
verses.kjv: 17 Behold, for peace I had great bitterness: but thou hast in love to my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption: for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back.
verses.niv: 17 Surely it was for my benefit that I suffered such anguish. In your love you kept me from the pit of destruction; you have put all my sins behind your back.

verses.esv:
15:1   A soft answer turns away wrath,
    but a harsh word stirs up anger.
verses.kjv: 1 A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
verses.niv: 1 A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

verses.esv: 19 Know this, my beloved brothers: let every person be quick to hear, slow to speak, slow to anger; 20 for the anger of man does not produce the righteousness of God.
verses.kjv: 19 Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath: 20 For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.
verses.niv: 19 My dear brothers, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry, 20 for man's anger does not bring about the righteous life that God desires.

verses.esv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.kjv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.niv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.

verses.esv: 32 Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.
verses.kjv: 32 And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ’s sake hath forgiven you.
verses.niv: 32 Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.

verses.esv: 2 Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewal of your mind, that by testing you may discern what is the will of God, what is good and acceptable and perfect.
verses.kjv: 2 And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.
verses.niv: 2 Do not conform any longer to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is--his good, pleasing and perfect will.

verses.esv: 10 She was deeply distressed and prayed to the LORD and wept bitterly.
verses.kjv: 10 And she was in bitterness of soul, and prayed unto the LORD, and wept sore.
verses.niv: 10 In bitterness of soul Hannah wept much and prayed to the LORD.
